glycemicIndexModules.name: Grains
glycemicIndexModules.instructions: Learn how different grains affect blood sugar levels.

data.name: White Rice
data.description: White rice has a high glycemic index, causing rapid blood sugar spikes.

data.name: Brown Rice
data.description: Brown rice has more fiber than white rice, causing a slower glucose rise.

data.name: Quinoa
data.description: Quinoa is a protein-rich grain with moderate glucose impact.

glycemicIndexModules.name: Fruits
glycemicIndexModules.instructions: Discover how different fruits impact your blood glucose levels.

data.name: Apple
data.description: Apples have fructose and fiber which helps offset the blood sugar increase.

data.name: Banana
data.description: Bananas cause a moderate rise in blood sugar due to natural sugars.

data.name: Grapes
data.description: Grapes can cause rapid blood sugar spikes due to high sugar content.

glycemicIndexModules.name: Vegetables
glycemicIndexModules.instructions: Learn about the blood sugar effects of different vegetables.

data.name: Carrot
data.description: Carrots have natural sugars but fiber slows absorption.

data.name: Broccoli
data.description: Broccoli has minimal impact on blood sugar.

data.name: Corn
data.description: Corn is higher in starch and can raise blood sugar significantly.
